intro: Psychotria welwitschii, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has elliptical, opposite leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria welwitschii is also noted for its chemical compounds, some of which have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
